intro: Maytenus grisea, commonly known as the gray mayten, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. It produces small, spherical fruits that are typically green when mature. Maytenus grisea is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of habitats including forests and dry woodlands.
